PROTECTING AGAINST CHILD EXPLOITATION ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROTECTING AGAINST CHILD EXPLOITATION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 91

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
Protecting Against Child Exploitation Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1761, to amend title 18, United States Code, to criminalize the knowing consent of the visual depiction, or live transmission, of a minor engaged in sexually explicit conduct, by a recorded vote of 368 ayes to 51 noes, Roll No. 284.

The House passed H.R. 1761, to amend title 18, United States Code, to criminalize the knowing consent of the visual depiction, or live transmission, of a minor engaged in sexually explicit conduct, by a recorded vote of 368 ayes to 51 noes, Roll No. 284.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 115-19 shall be considered as adopted, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary now printed in the bill.

PROTECTING YOUNG VICTIMS FROM SEXUAL ABUSE ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROTECTING YOUNG VICTIMS FROM SEXUAL ABUSE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 91

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Protecting Young Victims from Sexual Abuse Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1973, to prevent the sexual abuse of minors and amateur athletes by requiring the prompt reporting of sexual abuse to law enforcement authorities, by a yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas to 3 nays, Roll No. 285.
